>

There is no error recovery strategy, but the reporting is going to be d=
ifferent.

I think that, for me, it's partly a matter of "rightness" and th=
e rest is reporting. The "rightness" is that it is the Right Thing To Do(tm=
) to throw a IAE when receiving junk parameters. In your code fragment, the=
 different things that I might do would be to issue different errors to the=
 user or log file. An IAE means that the programmer goofed, while other err=
ors might be for less negligent reasons.

For example, if my code is readin=
g a file from a CD and someone ejects the CD during the process then I expe=
ct an error to be thrown, but it's not the fault of the programmer, so let'=
s put up a nice friendly end-user message that explains how difficult it is=
 to read data from a CD that isn't in the drive anymore.

As I type this re=
sponse, I realise that my whole programming perspective is driving my answe=
r. That is, that I very deliberately write what I call "2 a.m. code". This =
is code that someone else can debug at 2 a.m. without talking to me. I writ=
e VERY BORING and VERY STRAIGHTFORWARD code and I do it deliberately. I fin=
d two advantages to this: the first is that other people can support the co=
de more easily and the second is that boring, straightforward code breaks l=
ess often (my perception, no scientific proof).

I gained this worldview fr=
om trying to support other people's RPG code. There was one particular job =
that ran at 2 a.m. on Friday night/Saturday morning and by the time it fail=
ed and the operators paged me it would be 2:15 (almost exactly ... everytim=
e). The code was awful and that was when I started trying to write code (an=
d encourage others to also write their code that way) that any support prog=
rammer could read and understand and patch if necessary at 2 a.m.

I hope t=
his explains why I'm being so rigid about this. If I pass a junk value as a=
 parameter then I want an IllegalArgumentException. Don't give me a NullPoi=
nterException ... that tells me nothing at 2 a.m.!!! You can give me all th=
e theory that you want about how an NPE is fine if it's documented in the J=
avaDoc or some Big Book Of Documentation, but once you've supported some id=
iot's spagetti code at 2 a.m. (without the BBOD to hand), then theory doesn=
't appeal like it used to.

More than two cents, but less than a dollar. :-=
